intro: Deppea stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled deppea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
